content:
TITLE: Running LifterLMS Tests
DESCRIPTION: Various composer commands to run tests, including running all tests, tests by group, specific tests, and generating code coverage reports.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/tests/phpunit/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
composer run-script tests-run
composer run-script tests-run -- --group LLMS_Post_Model
composer run-script tests-run -- --filter test_my_test_method
composer run-script tests-run -- --coverage-html tmp/coverage
composer run-script tests-run -- --coverage-text
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Documenting Functions with DocBlocks in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Example of proper DocBlock formatting for functions and methods, including summary, description, changelog entries, and parameter/return documentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/documentation-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
/**
 * Summary.
 *
 * Description.
 *
 * @since x.x.x
 * @since x.x.x Description of function/method changes.
 *
 * @see Function/method/class relied on
 * @link URL
 *
 * @param type $var Description.
 * @param type $var Optional. Description. Default.
 * @return type Description.
 */
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining LifterLMS Core Classes in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the naming convention for LifterLMS core classes. Class names should use capitalized words separated by underscores and be prefixed with 'LLMS_'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/coding-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
class LLMS_Student extends LLMS_Abstract_User_Data { [...] }
class LLMS_Data { [...] }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing LifterLMS Test Environment
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install development dependencies and set up the testing database and environment for LifterLMS.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/tests/phpunit/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
composer install
composer run-script tests-install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Class DocBlock Format in PHP for LifterLMS
DESCRIPTION: Standard format for class documentation blocks in LifterLMS. Includes summary, optional description, references to related classes, and changelog entries with version numbers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/documentation-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
/**
 * Summary.
 *
 * Description.
 *
 * @see Super_Class
 *
 * @since x.x.x
 * @since x.x.x Description of class changes.
 */
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: File Header DocBlock Format in PHP for LifterLMS
DESCRIPTION: Standard format for file header documentation in LifterLMS. Includes summary, optional description, links, package information, and changelog entries with version numbers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/documentation-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
/**
 * Summary (no period for file headers)
 *
 * Description. (use period)
 *
 * @link URL
 *
 * @package LifterLMS/SecondaryPackage/TertiaryPackage
 *
 * @since x.x.x
 * @since x.x.x Description of file changes.
 * @version x.x.x
 */
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Docker Container Management Commands in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates various Docker container management commands that can be executed using Composer. These commands allow for creating configuration overrides, starting and stopping containers, listing containers, resetting the environment, and executing wp-cli commands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/tests/e2e/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
config:  Creates configuration override files
down:    Stop and remove containers and volumes
up:      Start containers
ps:      List containers
reset:   Destroy and recreate containers and volumes
restart: Restart containers
rm:      Remove containers and volumes
ssh:     Open an interactive bash session with the PHP service container
stop:    Stop containers without removing them
wp:      Execute a wp-cli command inside the PHP service container
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Hook DocBlock Format in PHP for LifterLMS
DESCRIPTION: Standard format for documenting action and filter hooks in LifterLMS. Includes summary, optional description, changelog entries, and parameter details with type information and descriptions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/documentation-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
/**
 * Summary.
 *
 * Description.
 *
 * @since x.x.x
 * @since x.x.x Description of hook changes.
 *
 * @param type  $var Description.
 * @param array $args {
 *     Short description about this hash.
 *
 *     @type type $var Description.
 *     @type type $var Description.
 * }
 * @param type  $var Description.
 */
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: PHP Function Declaration with DocBlock and Parameters
DESCRIPTION: Example of a PHP function with proper parameter and return documentation in the DocBlock.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/documentation-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
/**
 * @param string $var1 Description of the argument.
 * @param bool   $var2 Description of the argument.
 * @return string
 */
function my_function( $var1, $var2 = false ) {
    ...
    return $var1;
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Documenting Class Properties with DocBlocks in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to document class variables or properties using the @var tag to specify the variable type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/documentation-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
/**
 * @var string
 */
public $var = 'text';
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Documenting Function with Exception Handling in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to document a function that throws an exception using the @throws tag below the @return tag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/documentation-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
/**
 * @return string
 *
 * @throws Exception A description of the raised exception.
 */
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating GitHub Releases with LifterLMS CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command for creating GitHub releases and tags from specified files or branches. Supports options for archive handling, commit message customization, branch targeting, and release type configuration (prerelease, draft). Includes merge functionality for open PRs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage: index release create [options]

Create a GitHub release and tag from a specified file or branch.

Options:
  -a, --archive <zip>               If specified, the zip file will be
                                    committed and force-pushed to the specified
                                    branch before creating the release. Pass
                                    --no-archive to skip this step. (default:
                                    "dev-0.0.5.zip")
  -A, --no-archive                  Skip creation from an archive file and use
                                    the target --branch for release creation.
  -c, --commit-message <message>    Customize the commit message used when
                                    pushing to the target branch. Used only
                                    when releasing from an archive. The
                                    placeholder "%s" is replaced with the
                                    release version. (default: "Release v%s [ci
                                    skip]")
  -d, --dir <directory>             Directory where distribution files are
                                    stored. (default: "dist")
  -b, --branch <branch>             Target branch to use when creating the
                                    release. (default: "release")
  -l, --logfile <file>              Specify the changelog file. (default:
                                    "CHANGELOG.md")
  -p, --prerelease                  Mark the GitHub release as a prerelease and
                                    skip merging.
  -P, --prerelease-branch <branch>  When creating a prerelease, use this branch
                                    as the target branch in favor of the
                                    default branch specified via the --branch
                                    option. (default: "prerelease")
  -D, --draft                       Create the release as an unpublished draft
                                    and skip merging.
  -M, --merge <branch>              Merge open PRs on the specified branch
                                    before creating the release. If publishing
                                    a prerelease, or draft merging is
                                    automatically disabled as if passing
                                    "--no-merge". (default: "dev")
  -n, --no-merge                    Disable merging before release creation.
                                    Automatically passed when publishing a
                                    prerelease.
  -Y, --yes                         Skip confirmations.
  -v, --verbose                     Output extra information with result
                                    messages.
  -h, --help                        display help for command
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Version Numbers with LifterLMS CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command for updating project version numbers and replacing version placeholders in files. Provides extensive options for version incrementing, custom replacements, file exclusions, and version marking in various file types across the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage: index update-version [options]

Update the project version and replace all [version] placeholders.

Options:
  -i, --increment <level>                     Increment the version by the specified level. Accepts: major, minor, patch, premajor, preminor, prepatch, or prerelease. (default: "patch")
  -p, --preid <identifier>                    Identifier to be used to prefix premajor, preminor, prepatch or prerelease version increments.
  -F, --force <version>                       Specify an explicit version instead of incrementing the current version with --increment.
  -r, --replacements <replacement...>]        Replacements to be made. Each replacement is an array containing a list of globs for the files to be tested, a regex used to perform the replacement, and an optional list of RegEx flags (defaults to `g` if not supplied). It is recommended that this argument to configured via a configuration file as opposed to being passed via a CLI flag. (default: [["./**","(?<=@(?:since|version|deprecated) +)(\\[version\\])"],["./\*.php,./\*\*/\*.php","(?<=(?:_deprecated_argument|_deprecated_constructor|_deprecated_hook|_deprecated_file|_deprecated_function|_doing_it_wrong|apply_filters_deprecated|do_action_deprecated|llms_deprecated_function\\().+)(?<=')(\\[version\\])(?=')"],["*lifterlms*.php","(?<=[Vv]ersion *[:=] *[ '\"])(0|[1-9]d*)\\.(0|[1-9]\\d*)\\.(0|[1-9]\\d*)(?:-((?:0|[1-9]\\d*|\\d*[a-zA-Z-][0-9a-zA-Z-]*)(?:\\.(?:0|[1-9]\\d*|\\d*[a-zA-Z-][0-9a-zA-Z-]*))*))?(?:\\+([0-9a-zA-Z-]+(?:\\.[0-9a-zA-Z-]+)*))?"],["*lifterlms*.php","(?<=define\\( '(?:LLMS|LIFTERLMS).*_VERSION', ')(.*)(?=' \\);)"],["./style.css","(?<=Version: )(.+)"]])
  -e, --extra-replacements <replacement...>]  Additional replacements added to --replacements array. This option allows adding to the default replacements instead of overwriting them. (default: [])
  -E, --exclude <glob...>                     Specify files to exclude from the update. (default: "./vendor/**, ./node_modules/**, ./tmp/**, ./dist/**, ./docs/**, ./packages/**")
  -s, --skip-config                           Skip updating the version of the package.json or composer.json file. (default: true)
  -h, --help                                  display help for command
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using LifterLMS Core Hooks in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the usage of LifterLMS core hooks (actions and filters). Hook names should use lowercase letters, separate words with underscores, and be prefixed with 'llms_'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/coding-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
do_action( 'llms_user_enrolled_in_course', [...] );
apply_filters( 'llms_get_enrollment_status', [...] );
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using LifterLMS Add-on Hooks in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Shows the usage of LifterLMS add-on hooks. These should be prefixed with 'llms_' as well as an additional add-on prefix.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/coding-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
do_action( 'llms_pa_post_created_from_automation', [...] );
apply_filters( 'llms_sl_story_can_user_manage', [...] );
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining LifterLMS Core Functions in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the naming convention for LifterLMS core functions. Function names should use lowercase letters, separate words with underscores, and be prefixed with 'llms_'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/coding-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
llms_current_time( $type, $gmt = 0 ) { [...] }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating WordPress.org Plugin Repository README with LifterLMS CLI
DESCRIPTION: This command generates a readme.txt file for the WordPress.org plugin repository. It supports various options for specifying input files, output location, and readme customization, along with merge codes for dynamic content insertion.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage: index readme [options]

Create a readme.txt file suitable for the WordPress.org plugin repository.

Options:
  -o, --output-file <filename>     Specify the output readme file name.
                                   (default: "readme.txt")
  -i, --input-file <filename>      Specify the input changelog file name.
                                   (default: "CHANGELOG.md")
  -m, --main-file <filename>       Specify the project main file name where
                                   metadata is stored. (default: "dev.php")
  -d, --dir <directory>            Directory where the readme part files are
                                   stored (default: ".wordpress-org/readme")
  -l, --changelog-length <number>  Specify the number of versions to display
                                   before truncating the changelog. (default:
                                   10)
  -r, --read-more <url>            Specify the "Read More" url where changelogs
                                   are published. (default:
                                   "https://make.lifterlms.com/tag/dev")
  -h, --help                       display help for command

Merge codes:
  The following merge codes can be used in any of the readme part markdown files.

  | Merge Code                    | Description                                                            | Source       |
  | ----------------------------- | -----------------------------------------------------------------------| ------------ |
  | {{__CHANGELOG_ENTRIES__}}     | The most recent 10 changelog entries.                                  | --input-file |
  | {{__LICENSE__}}               | The project's license (GPLv3).                                         | --main-file  |
  | {{__LICENSE_URI__}}           | The URI to the project's license.                                      | --main-file  |
  | {{__MIN_WP_VERSION__}}        | The minimum required WordPress core version.                           | --main-file  |
  | {{__MIN_LLMS_VERSION__}}      | The minimum required LifterLMS version.                                | --main-file  |
  | {{__MIN_PHP_VERSION__}}       | The minimum required PHP version.                                      | --main-file  |
  | {{__PROJECT_URI__}}           | The project's URI.                                                     | --main-file  |
  | {{__READ_MORE_LINK__}}        | A link to the full project changelog.                                  | --main-file  |
  | {{__SHORT_DESCRIPTION__}}     | A short description of the project.                                    | --main-file  |
  | {{__TESTED_LLMS_VERSION__}}   | The latest LifterLMS version the project has been tested against.      | --main-file  |
  | {{__TESTED_WP_VERSION__}}     | The latest WordPress core version the project has been tested against. | --main-file  |
  | {{__VERSION__}}               | The current project version.                                           | package.json |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring block.json for LifterLMS Blocks
DESCRIPTION: Example of a block.json configuration file for a LifterLMS block. The file sets the block name, title, category, and other metadata required for WordPress block registration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/block-development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "$schema": "https://schemas.wp.org/trunk/block.json",
  "apiVersion": 2,
  "name": "llms/example-block",
  "title": "Example",
  "category": "llms-blocks",
  "description": "Block description",
  "textdomain": "lifterlms",
  "attributes": {},
  "supports": {},
  "editorScript": "file:./index.js"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating i18n files with LifterLMS Dev CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command usage and options for generating internationalization pot and json files using WP-CLI, with customizable text domain, file exclusions, and headers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage: index pot [options]

Generate i18n pot and json files using the WP-CLI.

Options:
  -d, --text-domain <text-domain>  Specify the text domain. Used to generate
                                   the filenames for generated files. (default:
                                   "dev")
  -e, --exclude <glob...>          Specify files to exclude from scanning.
                                   (default: "vendor/**, node_modules/**,
                                   tmp/**, dist/**, docs/**, src/**, tests/**,
                                   *.js.map")
  -ee, --extra-exclude <glob...>   Additional files to add to the --exclude
                                   option.
  -d, --dir <directory>            Output directory where generated files will
                                   be stored. (default: "i18n")
  -t, --translator <translator>    Customize the Last Translator header.
                                   (default: "Team LifterLMS
                                   <team@lifterlms.com>")
  -b, --bugs <url>                 Customize the bug report location header.
                                   (default:
                                   "https://lifterlms.com/my-account/my-tickets")
  -h, --help                       display help for command
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Registering a Block with JavaScript in LifterLMS
DESCRIPTION: Example JavaScript code for registering a new block in LifterLMS. The code imports block registration functions from WordPress and uses the block.json data to register the block with edit and save functions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/block-development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import { registerBlockType } from '@wordpress/blocks';
import blockJson from './block.json';

registerBlockType( blockJson, {
    edit: ( props ) => {
        return <p>{ props.name }</p>;
    },
    save: ( props ) => {
        return <p>{ props.name }</p>;
    },
} );
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Default Options for LifterLMS Dev Tool with YAML
DESCRIPTION: An annotated example of a YAML configuration file that customizes default options for various commands in the LifterLMS development tool. This configuration sets the 'inspect' flag to true for the archive command and sets the default 'type' to 'added' for the changelog add command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
# Configure the archive command defaults, eg `llms-dev archive`.
archive:
  # Equivalent to always passing `llms-dev archive --inspect`.
  inspect: true

# Configure the the changelog add command, eg `llms-dev changelog add`
changelog.add
  type: added

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Registering LifterLMS Block with PHP
DESCRIPTION: Example PHP code for registering a block with WordPress. The code adds an initialization hook that registers the block type using the block.json file located in the plugin directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/block-development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
add_action( 'init', 'llms_register_example_block' );
/**
 * Register the example block.
 *
 * @since 1.0.0
 *
 * @return void
 */
function llms_register_example_block() {
    register_block_type( LLMS_PLUGIN_DIR . 'blocks/example-block' );
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing LifterLMS Utils in an Add-on
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to access LifterLMS utils in an add-on by adding 'llms-utils' as a dependency to your script and accessing it through the window.llms.utils global object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/utils/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const { getAdminUrl } = window.llms.utils;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Directory Structure for LifterLMS Block Development
DESCRIPTION: Shows the recommended directory structure for a new LifterLMS block. The structure includes the main project directory with src/blocks subdirectory containing the block folder with necessary files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/block-development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
.
└── project/
    ├── src/
    │   └── blocks/
    │       └── block/
    │           ├── block.json
    │           ├── index.jsx
    │           └── index.scss # optional.
    ├── package.json
    └── webpack.congif.js
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating changelog entries with LifterLMS Dev CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command usage and options for adding new changelog entries, including significance level, type, comments, issue links, and attributions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage: index changelog add [options]

Create a new changelog entry.

Options:
  -s, --significance <level>     The semantic version significance of the
                                 change. Accepts: major, minor, patch.
                                 (default: "patch")
  -t, --type <type>              The type of change. Accepts: added, changed,
                                 fixed, deprecated, removed, dev, performance,
                                 security. (default: "changed")
  -c, --comment <comment>        An internal-use comment to include with the
                                 changelog entry which is not published with
                                 the final changelog.
  -l, --links <issues...>        Link the changelog to one or more GitHub
                                 issues. Can be provided multiple times to link
                                 to multiple issues.
  -a, --attributions <users...>  Attribute the changelog entry to one or more
                                 individuals. Attributions are provided to
                                 thank contributions which originate from
                                 outside the LifterLMS organization. Provide a
                                 GitHub username or a markdown-formatted
                                 anchor. Can be provided multiple times to
                                 attribute to multiple users.
  -e, --entry <entry>            The changelog entry.
  -T, --title <title>            Changelog entry file name. Uses the current
                                 git branch name as the default. Automatically
                                 appends a number to the title if the title
                                 already exists. (default: "trunk")
  -i, --interactive              Create the changelog interactively. (default:
                                 false)
  -E, --use-editor               When creating a changelog interactively, will
                                 open an editor to write the entry, This is
                                 useful when creating multi-line entries.
  -d, --dir <directory>          Directory where changelog entries are stored.
                                 (default: ".changelogs")
  -h, --help                     display help for command
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding FontAwesome Icons to LifterLMS Blocks
DESCRIPTION: Example JavaScript code showing how to add a FontAwesome icon to a LifterLMS block. The code converts an SVG icon to a React component and registers it with the block.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/block-development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import { registerBlockType } from '@wordpress/blocks';
import { SVG, Path } from '@wordpress/primitives';

const Icon = () => (
	<SVG xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 640 512">
		<Path
			d="M592 416H48c-26.5 0-48-21.5-48-48V144c0-26.5 21.5-48 48-48h544c26.5 0 48 21.5 48 48v224c0 26.5-21.5 48-48 48z"
		/>
	</SVG>
);

registerBlockType( blockJson, {
  icon: Icon,
  edit: Edit
} );
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Writing changelog entries with LifterLMS Dev CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command usage and options for writing changelog entries to the changelog file with customizable version, date, and formatting options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage: index changelog write [options]

Write existing changelog entries to the changelog file.

Options:
  -p, --preid <identifier>  Identifier to be used to prefix premajor, preminor,
                            prepatch or prerelease version increments.
  -F, --force <version>     Use the specified version string instead of
                            determining the version based on changelog entry
                            significance.
  -l, --log-file <file>     The changelog file. (default: "CHANGELOG.md")
  -d, --date <YYYY-MM-DD>   Changelog publication date. (default: "2022-08-11")
  -L, --links               Add GitHub links to templates and issues in
                            changelog entries. (default: false)
  -n, --no-links            Do not add GitHub links in changelog entries. Use
                            this option to override the --links flag.
  -D, --dry-run             Output what would be written to the changelog
                            instead of writing it to the changelog file.
  -k, --keep-entries        Preserve entry files deletion after the changelog
                            is written.
  -d, --dir <directory>     Directory where changelog entries are stored.
                            (default: ".changelogs")
  -h, --help                display help for command
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Registering LifterLMS Shortcode Blocks with PHP Filter
DESCRIPTION: Example PHP code for registering shortcode blocks in a LifterLMS add-on plugin. The code uses the llms_shortcode_blocks filter to register a block with its render function and path.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/block-development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
add_filter( 'llms_shortcode_blocks', register_blocks( array $config ): array {
    $config['group-list'] = array(
        'render' => array( 'LLMS_Groups_Shortcode_Group_List', 'output' ),
        'path'   => LLMS_GROUPS_PLUGIN_DIR . 'assets/blocks/group-list',
    );

    return $config;
} );
```

TITLE: Configuring Webpack for WordPress Blocks

SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/scripts/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: js

```
const blocksConfig = require( '@lifterlms/scripts/config/blocks-webpack.config' );
module.exports = blocksConfig;
```

TITLE: Defining LifterLMS CSS Classes and IDs in HTML
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the naming convention for LifterLMS CSS classes and IDs. They should be lowercase, prefixed with 'llms-', and use hyphens to separate words.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/coding-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<div class="llms-element-name" id="llms-element-id"></div>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Validating changelog entries with LifterLMS Dev CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command usage and options for validating existing changelog entries with customizable output formats and validation options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage: index changelog validate [options] [entries...]

Validate existing changelog entries.

Arguments:
  entries                Optionally specify a list of changelog entries to
                         validate. If omitted will validate all existing
                         entries.

Options:
  -f, --format [format]  Output format. Accepts: list, json, yaml. (default:
                         "list")
  -s, --silent           Skip validation output and communicate validation
                         status only through the exit status of the command.
  -d, --dir <directory>  Directory where changelog entries are stored.
                         (default: ".changelogs")
  -h, --help             display help for command
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining LifterLMS Form Element Names in HTML
DESCRIPTION: Shows the naming convention for LifterLMS form element 'name' attributes. They should be prefixed with 'llms_', use lowercase letters, and separate words with underscores.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/coding-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<form>
   <input name="llms_text_field" type="text">
</form>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing changelog entries with LifterLMS Dev CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command usage and options for listing existing changelog entries from the specified directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage: index changelog list [options]

List existing changelog entries.

Options:
  -d, --dir <directory>  Directory where changelog entries are stored.
                         (default: ".changelogs")
  -h, --help             display help for command
```

TITLE: Webpack Configuration for Font Awesome Build
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript configuration for webpack to build Font Awesome assets. Adds an entry point for the Font Awesome SCSS file to generate CSS and font files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/fontawesome/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const { resolve } = require( 'path' ),
	config = generate( {} );

config.entry.fontawesome = resolve( './src/scss/fa-file.scss' );

module.exports = config;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Getting version information with LifterLMS Dev CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command usage and options for retrieving current or next version information based on changelog entries.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage: index changelog version [options] <which>

List existing changelog entries.

Arguments:
  which                     Which version to retrieve. Accepts: current, next.

Options:
  -p, --preid <identifier>  Identifier to be used to prefix premajor, preminor,
                            prepatch or prerelease version increments.
  -d, --dir <directory>     Directory where changelog entries are stored.
                            (default: ".changelogs")
  -h, --help                display help for command
```

TITLE: Parsing metadata with LifterLMS Dev CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command usage and options for retrieving metadata from the project's main file with customizable output formats.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage: index meta parse [options]

Retrieves metadata from the project's main file.

Options:
  -F, --file <file>      Main project file name. (default: "dev.php")
  -k, --key <key>        Retrieves a single metadata by key name.
  -f, --format [format]  Output format. Accepts: table, json, yaml. (default:
                         "table")
  -h, --help             display help for command
```

TITLE: Importing and Using LifterLMS Brand SCSS Components
DESCRIPTION: Examples of importing LifterLMS brand SCSS files and using color, gradient, and typography utilities. Requires node_modules to be included in SASS load path.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/brand/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
// Import all brand files.
@import '@lifterlms/brand/sass/brand'

// Import colors only.
@import '@lifterlms/brand/sass/colors'

// Import typography only.
@import '@lifterlms/brand/sass/typography'

// Use a color.
body {
  background: llms-color( llms-blue );
}

// Use the gradient mixin.
.banner {
  @include llms-gradient-bg();
}

// Use a font.
body {
  font-family: llms-font( llms-sans );
}
```

TITLE: Rendering Reporting Widget with Comparison in HTML
DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet creates a reporting widget within a grid column. It displays an icon, a numeric value, a percentage comparison to a previous value, and a label. The widget includes conditional classes for styling and comparison indicators.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/tests/phpunit/unit-tests/admin/reporting/__snapshots__/admin-reporting-output_widget-test-a.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: HTML
CODE:
```
<div class="d-1of2">
	<div class="llms-reporting-widget test-a" id="test-a">
					<i class="fa fa-mocking-bird" aria-hidden="true"></i>
				<div class="llms-reporting-widget-data">
			<strong>123</strong>
							<small class="compare tooltip negative" title="Previously 456">
					-270.73%
				</small>
					</div>
		<small>Test Letter A</small>
	</div>
</div>
```

TITLE: Rendering LifterLMS Reporting Widget in HTML
DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet creates a reporting widget for LifterLMS, displaying test results. It includes a percentage value, a comparison to previous performance, and uses Font Awesome icons for visual enhancement. The widget is designed to be one half of a two-column layout.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/tests/phpunit/unit-tests/admin/reporting/__snapshots__/admin-reporting-output_widget-test-b.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: HTML
CODE:
```
<div class="d-1of2">
	<div class="llms-reporting-widget test-b" id="test-b">
					<i class="fa fa-mocking-bird" aria-hidden="true"></i>
				<div class="llms-reporting-widget-data">
			<strong>1.24<sup>%</sup></strong>
							<small class="compare tooltip negative" title="Previously 5.92%">
					-379.35%
				</small>
					</div>
		<small>Test Letter B</small>
	</div>
</div>
```

TITLE: Rendering LifterLMS Price Widget with Discount Comparison
DESCRIPTION: HTML structure for displaying a course price with a comparison to the previous price, including a percentage change indicator. The widget contains a formatted price of $45.90 with a negative percentage indicating a price reduction from the previous value of $200.32.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/tests/phpunit/unit-tests/admin/reporting/__snapshots__/admin-reporting-output_widget-test-e.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

CODE:
```
<div class="d-1of2">
	<div class="llms-reporting-widget test-e" id="test-e">
				<div class="llms-reporting-widget-data">
			<strong><span class="lifterlms-price"><span class="llms-price-currency-symbol">$</span>45.90</span></strong>
							<small class="compare tooltip positive" title="Previously 200.32">
					-336.43%
				</small>
					</div>
		<small>Test Letter E</small>
	</div>
</div>
```

TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables for LifterLMS E2E Testing
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the required environment variables that must be added to a .llmsenv file for running E2E tests against a real website. It includes WordPress site URL, admin username, and password configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/e2e-tests-real.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
WP_BASE_URL=https://yourwebsiteurl.tld
WP_USERNAME=adminusername
WP_PASSWORD=adminpassword
```

TITLE: Class Member DocBlock Format in PHP for LifterLMS
DESCRIPTION: Standard format for documenting class properties and constants in LifterLMS. Includes summary, changelog entries, and type declaration with optional description.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/documentation-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
/**
 * Summary.
 *
 * @since x.x.x
 * @since x.x.x Description of member changes.
 * @var type Optional description.
 */
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Documenting Array Parameters in PHP DocBlocks
DESCRIPTION: Example of documenting an array parameter with multiple options using WordPress-style hash notation and @type tags.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/documentation-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
/**
 * @param array $args {
 *     Optional. An array of arguments.
 *
 *     @type type $key Description. Default 'value'. Accepts 'value', 'value'.
 *                     (aligned with Description, if wraps to a new line)
 *     @type type $key Description.
 * }
 */
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: PHP Status Array Example in DocBlock Code Sample
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to include a code sample in a DocBlock description by indenting it with 4 spaces.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/docs/documentation-standards.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
/**
 * Description including a code sample:
 *
 *    $status = array(
 *        'draft'   => __( 'Draft' ),
 *        'pending' => __( 'Pending Review' ),
 *        'private' => __( 'Private' ),
 *        'publish' => __( 'Published' )
 *    );
 *
 * The description continues on ...
 */
```

TITLE: Implementing the Quill Word Count Module in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to register and use the word count module with a Quill editor instance. Demonstrates importing the module, registering it with Quill, and configuring it with options including an onChange callback.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/quill-wordcount-module/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import quillWordcountModule from '@lifterlms/quill-wordcount-module';

( function() {
	// Registers the module with Quill.
	quillWordcountModule();

	// Loads the module in a new editor instance.
	const ed = = new Quill( '#my-quill-container', {
		modules: {
			wordcount: {
				onChange: ( quill, options, wordCount ) => {
					// Do something when the editor's text updates and you need to know the new word count.
				},
			},
		},
	} );

} )();
```

```
module.exports = config;
```

TITLE: Preparing Releases with LifterLMS CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command for preparing and building a LifterLMS release. Supports options for version specification, prerelease identifiers, non-interactive mode, and custom build script configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage: index release prepare [options]

Prepare and build a release.

Options:
  -F, --force <version>     Specify a version to use. If not specified uses
                            `changelog version next` to determine the version.
  -p, --preid <identifier>  Identifier to be used to prefix premajor, preminor,
                            prepatch or prerelease version increments.
  -y, --yes                 Specify no-interaction mode. Responds "yes" to all
                            confirmation prompts.
  -b, --build <cmd>         Specify an npm script to use for the build command.
                            (default: "build")
  -B, --no-build            Disabled build script.
  -h, --help                display help for command
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Distribution Archive with LifterLMS CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command for building a distribution archive (.zip) file for the LifterLMS project. It provides options for automatic inspection of the created file, specifying the output directory, and verbose output for troubleshooting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocodebox/lifterlms.git/blob/trunk/packages/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage: index release archive [options]

Build a distribution archive (.zip) file for the project.

Options:
  -i, --inspect    Automatically unzip the zip file after creation. (default:
                   false)
  -d, --dir <dir>  Directory where the generated archive file will be saved,
                   relative to the project root directory. (default: "dist")
  -v, --verbose    Output extra information with result messages. (default:
                   false)
  -h, --help       display help for command
```
